name: Ramen Omelet with Spinach, Mushrooms, and Cheese
ingredients: 1 (3 ounce) package ramen, seasoning packets discarded
salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
directions: Step 1. Bring 2 cups of water to a boil in a saucepan; add ramen and cook until tender, about 3 minutes. Drain and set aside.

Step 2. Melt 1 tablespoon butter in a skillet. Add mushrooms; cook and stir until tender, about 5 minutes. Add spinach and cook until wilted, stirring constantly, about 2 minutes. Remove from skillet and set aside.

Step 3. Mix eggs with splash of milk in a bowl. Melt remaining 1 tablespoon butter in the same skillet. Add eggs, top with half of the ramen, 1/2 of the mushroom-spinach mixture, and 1/4 cup cheese. Season with salt and pepper. Once eggs are set, fold omelet in half and top with remaining mushroom mixture and remaining cheese.

name: Puppy Chow Crispy Treats
ingredients: 2 tablespoons creamy peanut butter (such as Skippy)
directions:
Step 1. Gather all ingredients.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 2. Place chocolate chips, 3/4 cup peanut butter, and 4 tablespoons butter in a large microwave-safe heatproof bowl. Microwave on HIGH until melted and smooth, stirring every 30 seconds, 1 1/2 to 2 minutes; stir in salt.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 3. Place cereal into a very large bowl. Pour melted chocolate mixture over cereal; fold until cereal is evenly coated. Let rest for 15 minutes. Rinse and dry bowl used to melt chocolate mixture and set aside.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 4. Add 1 cup powdered sugar to cereal mixture; fold until evenly coated (it’s ok if some powdered sugar dissolves). Spread into an even layer on a large-rimmed, parchment-lined baking sheet and set aside. Rinse and dry bowl used to coat cereal mixture and set aside.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 5. Place remaining 4 tablespoons butter and marshmallows in reserved large bowl. Microwave on HIGH until marshmallows have puffed and start turning into one mass, about 45 seconds. Stir well and add 2 tablespoons peanut butter. Microwave for 30 more seconds, and stir again until smooth. Place cereal mixture back into reserved very large bowl and pour marshmallow mixture over cereal. Quickly fold and stir until evenly coated.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 6. Spray a 13-x 9-inch baking pan with cooking spray. Spread cereal mixture into pan, lightly pressing into an even layer; let sit at room temperature until set, about 1 hour.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 7. Sift remaining 1 tablespoon powdered sugar over cereal mixture, cut into 12 (3-x-3.25- inch) pieces and serve.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

name: Bloody Maria
directions: Step 1. Place Tajin on a plate. Moisten the rim of a glass with a lime wedge. Press the moistened rim into Tajin. Set aside.

Step 2. Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Add tomato juice, tequila, lime juice, Worcestershire sauce, Tabasco, horseradish, and celery seed. Shake until the outside of shaker is frosted; strain into the prepared glass.

name: Bloody Caesar
directions: Step 1. Sprinkle celery salt onto a plate. Moisten the rim of a glass with lime wedge. Press the moistened rim into the salt. Fill glass with ice.

Step 2. Add vodka, Worcestershire sauce, and Tabasco sauce, then fill with Clamato juice and gently stir. Sprinkle in a pinch of celery salt, then garnish with lime wedge, celery stick and other preferred garnishes.

name: 15 Fall Breakfast Recipes That Will Keep You Warm and Cozy All Season Long
Croque Monsieur Casserole
directions: Step 1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Lightly grease a baking dish. Melt 6 tablespoons butter.

Step 2. Place English muffin cubes in a large bowl and top with melted butter and Dijon mustard. Toss until well coated and place spread out in an even layer on a baking sheet. Bake until lightly browned and lightly toasted, 12 to 14 minutes.
Step 3. Meanwhile, whisk together eggs, half-and-half, 1 teaspoon salt and 1/2 teaspoon pepper in a bowl until well combined and set aside.

Step 4. Place half of bread cubes in the prepared baking dish. Fold half of the ham slices and tear into 1 ½-inch pieces and disperse ham between bread cubes. Top evenly with 2 cups of grated Swiss cheese.
Step 5. Top with remaining bread, ham, and grated Swiss cheese. Pour egg mixture over casserole and press lightly to submerge most of the bread. Let stand at room temperature for 30 minutes.
Step 6. Bake casserole until egg mixture is absorbed, 45 to 50 minutes. Cover with foil during the last 20 minutes of baking time if casserole is browning too quickly.

Step 7. Meanwhile, melt remaining butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Whisk in flour and cook, stirring constantly, about 1 minute. Whisk in milk until smooth. Bring mixture to a boil and reduce heat to simmer, stirring occasionally until thickened, about 3 minutes. Add in remaining salt, pepper, and nutmeg and stir. Cook about 8 minutes on low, stirring occasionally, and remove from heat.

Step 8. Remove casserole from oven and turn on the oven’s broiler. Pour cream sauce over casserole and top with grated Parmesan. Place casserole back in oven and broil until bubbly and lightly browned, about 3 minutes. Let stand for 5 to 10 minutes. Sprinkle with chives and serve.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

name: Caramel Apple Overnight Oats
directions:
Step 1. Gather all ingredients.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 2. Stir together oats, apple cider, yogurt, caramel sauce, chia seeds, apple pie spice, and 1 cup of the apples in a medium bowl until combined.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 3. Drizzle caramel sauce inside 4 (12-oz.) jars.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 4. Spoon oat mixture evenly into prepared jars (about 1 1/4 cups each). Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 8 hours or up to 4 days.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 5. When ready to serve, top each with 1/4 cup remaining apples and drizzle with additional caramel sauce. Top as desired.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

name: Individual Bourbon-Pecan French Toast Bakes
ingredients: 4 cups whole-grain or challah bread cubes
directions: Step 1. Grease 4 (8 to 10 ounce) ramekins. Whisk together milk, eggs, maple syrup, bourbon, vanilla, cinnamon, and salt in a large bowl. Add bread. Toss to combine. Divide among prepared ramekins. Chill, covered, at least 2 hours or up to overnight.
Step 2. Meanwhile, make Toasted Pecan Butter: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Spread pecans on a rimmed baking sheet.
Step 3. Toast in the preheated oven, stirring once or twice, until lightly browned and fragrant, 12 to 15 minutes. Watch closely so they don’t burn. Let cool to room temperature.

Step 4. Pulse butter, brown sugar, and vanilla in a food processor until combined. Add cooled pecans. Pulse until mixture reaches desired consistency. Chill Toasted Pecan Butter in an airtight container up to 1 month.

Step 5. To assemble: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). For streusel, stir together flour and brown sugar in a medium bowl. Cut in butter with a pastry blender or 2 knives until mixture resembles coarse crumbs; stir in pecans. Sprinkle streusel over bread mixture in ramekins.

Step 6. Bake in the preheated oven until puffed and a knife inserted into centers comes out clean, about 30 minutes. Serve warm with Toasted Pecan Butter and garnish with powdered sugar.
To make dry bread cubes, preheat oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C). Cut 8 ounces fresh bread into 3/4-inch cubes. Spread cubes on a 10x15-inch rimmed baking sheet. Bake, stirring twice, until dry, 10 to 15 minutes. Let cool (cubes will continue to crisp). Alternatively, let bread cubes stand, loosely covered, at room temperature until dry, 8 to 12 hours.Toasted Pecan Butter recipe submitted by Carrie Mae.

name: Smoked Salmon Breakfast Casserole
ingredients: capers and lemon wedges, for serving
directions: Step 1. Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Coat a 9x13-inch baking dish with cooking spray.
Step 2. Spread half of the toasted bagel pieces in prepared dish. Top with 1 1/2 cups Swiss cheese, the cream cheese, and smoked salmon. Top with remaining bagel pieces.
Step 3. Whisk together eggs, milk, sour cream, and dill in a bowl. Pour over mixture in baking dish. Press bagel pieces with the back of a spoon to coat in egg mixture.

Step 4. Bake in the preheated oven for 45 minutes. Sprinkle with remaining 1/2 cup cheese. Bake 5 to 10 minutes more, until set and an instant-read thermometer inserted into center of casserole registers 160 degrees F (71 degrees C). Let stand about 10 minutes before serving. Garnish with additional dill and serve with capers, lemon wedges, and/or additional sour cream.
Make Ahead: Prepare as directed through Step 3. Chill, covered, at least 2 hours and up to 24 hours. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Prepare as directed in Step 4, except increase initial baking time to 55 minutes.

name: Baked Feta Eggs
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
directions: Step 1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C), and spray 2 oven-safe ramekins with cooking spray.

Step 2. Combine tomatoes, red onions, and garlic in a small bowl and divide evenly between ramekins. Sprinkle with feta cheese, drizzle with olive oil, and sprinkle with oregano. Place ramekins on a baking sheet.
Step 3. Bake in the preheated oven for 8 minutes. Remove from oven; do not turn oven off.
Step 4. Gently stir feta into tomato mixture. With the back of a spoon, make indentations in tomato mixture. Crack an egg into each indentation.

Step 5. Return ramekins to the oven, and bake until egg whites are opaque but yolks are still runny, or cooked to your taste, 10 to 14 minutes. Season with salt and pepper, garnish with basil, and serve.

name: Breakfast Nachos
ingredients: 3/4 cup cilantro leaves and tender stems
1/2 cup parsley leaves and tender stems
1 (8 ounce) flat iron steak, patted dry
2 (8 ounce) packages shredded Mexican cheese blend (such as Tilamook
1/2 cup sour cream, or as needed
directions:
Step 1. Gather all ingredients.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 2. For chimichurri: Place cilantro, parsley, garlic, vinegar, crushed red pepper, and salt in a small food processor; pulse until finely chopped, about 10 pulses. With processor running, pour oil through food chute, and process until fully incorporated, about 20 seconds; set aside.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 3. For steak: Sprinkle steak evenly with 1/2 teaspoon of the salt, 1/4 teaspoon of the black pepper, and cumin, as desired. Heat a medium cast-iron skillet over medium-high for 5 minutes. Add steak and 1 tablespoon of the oil, swirling to distribute oil evenly. Cook, undisturbed, until nicely browned and a thermometer inserted into thickest portion of steak registers 120 degreed F (49 degrees ) for rare, about 3 minutes per side. Transfer to a cutting board, and let rest 10 minutes. Do not wipe skillet clean.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 4. Meanwhile, whisk together eggs and remaining 1/4 teaspoon each salt and black pepper in a medium bowl until thoroughly blended. Heat cast-iron skillet over medium. Add remaining 1 tablespoon oil and eggs; cook, stirring occasionally, until just set, about 2 minutes. Transfer to a bowl; cover, and set aside.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios
Step 5. Preheat the oven’s broiler and place a rack about 12 inches from the heat source. Line a large rimmed baking sheet with aluminum foil.

Step 6. To assemble nachos, arrange half of tortilla chips in an even layer on prepared baking sheet. Thinly slice steak across the grain, and cut into 3/4-inch pieces. Sprinkle tortilla chips evenly with half of steak, half of beans, half of eggs, and half of Mexican blend cheese. Repeat with remaining chips, steak, beans, eggs, and cheese.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 7. Broil until cheese is melted and bubbly, about 2 minutes. Top with tomatoes, avocado, and pickled jalapeños. Drizzle evenly with chimichurri, and serve with sour cream.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

name: Brioche French Toast Casserole
ingredients: 2 tablespoons pure maple syrup, plus more for serving
1 (16- oz.) day-old brioche loaf, cut into 1-inch cubes
directions:
Step 1. Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 2. Stir together brown sugar, flour, melted butter, salt, and 1/2 teaspoon of the cinnamon in a medium bowl until crumbly; set aside.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 3. Lightly coat a 9-x 13-inch baking dish with cooking spray. Whisk together milk, heavy cream, eggs, maple syrup, vanilla, and remaining 1 1/2 teaspoons cinnamon in a large bowl until fully combined. Toss cubed brioche in milk mixture until all pieces are moistened. (Milk mixture will not be completely absorbed.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 4. Transfer mixture to prepared baking dish, and sprinkle evenly with granulated sugar.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 5. Sprinkle brown sugar mixture evenly over top of bread mixture. Let casserole stand 10 minutes at room temperature.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 6. Bake in preheated oven until casserole is set and bread is golden brown and puffy, 35 to 40 minutes. Remove from oven, and serve immediately with additional maple syrup.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

name: Granola Cups
ingredients: nonstick baking spray with flour (such as Baker's Joy®)
1 cup plain whole milk Greek yogurt, or as needed
directions: Step 1. Place butter and maple syrup in a large bowl and place into the microwave. Heat in 30 second intervals, stirring after every 30 seconds, until butter is melted, about 1 to 1 1/2 minutes. Remove bowl from microwave and add in vanilla, cinnamon, salt, and nutmeg. Stir until thoroughly combined. Add in oats, almonds, coconut, and flax meal. Stir until mixture is thoroughly combined.
Step 2. Generously grease a standard muffin tin with nonstick baking spray with flour.

Step 3. Divide oat mixture evenly between the muffin cups, about 2 heaped tablespoons per cup. With wet hands, press mixture into the bottom and up the sides of each cup. Place the pan into the fridge to chill for 15 minutes.
Step 4. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Step 5. Bake chilled granola cups in the preheated oven until the outside edges of cups turn golden brown,  25 to 30 minutes. Remove cups from the oven; cool to room temperature in the pan, about 30 minutes.
Step 6. Use an offset spatula or butter knife to pop them out of the pan. To serve, fill each granola cup with yogurt and top with berries. Serve immediately.

name: Flat Croissant with Nutella and Berries
ingredients: 1 tablespoon chocolate hazelnut spread (such as Nutella®)
directions: Step 1. Use a rolling pin or hands to flatten the croissant to 1/4-inch thick.

Step 2. Heat butter a medium skillet over medium heat until melted. Place croissant in skillet, bottom side down, and press firmly with bottom of a smaller skillet or saucepan until lightly browned, about 3 minutes.  Drizzle honey evenly over croissant and add remaining butter to skillet. Flip croissant over and press again, cooking until the top side is lightly browned and toasted, about 2 minutes. Remove to a plate to cool.
Step 3. Spread Nutella over the croissant and top with berries as desired.

name: Carrot Cake Pancakes
ingredients: ¼ cup packed light brown sugar
3 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted, plus more for griddle
3 tablespoons toasted chopped pecans or walnuts
directions:
Step 1. Gather all ingredients.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios
Step 2. To make the pancake batter: Whisk flour, baking powder, cinnamon, pumpkin pie spice, baking soda, and salt together in a large bowl.

Step 3. Add buttermilk, brown sugar, egg, and vanilla; stir until just combined. Stir in carrots and melted butter until just combined. Set batter aside while you prepare the frosting and topping.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 4. To make the frosting: Whisk cream cheese, milk, powdered sugar, and vanilla together in a medium bowl until smooth. Set aside.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios
Step 5. To prepare the topping: Stir raisins, pecans, coconut, and ginger together in a small bowl. Set aside.
Step 6. Heat a large nonstick skillet or griddle over medium heat; grease with butter.

Step 7. Working in batches, scoop 1/4 cup batter per pancake into the skillet, being sure not to overcrowd it. Cook until bubbles begin to form on surface of pancakes and edges look dry, 2 to 3 minutes. Flip, and cook until fluffy and slightly firm, about 1 minute. Repeat with remaining batter, adding butter and adjusting heat as needed.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 8. Divide pancakes evenly among 4 plates; drizzle evenly with frosting and sprinkle evenly with topping.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

name: Chorizo Breakfast Casserole
ingredients: 1 teaspoon freshly ground freshly ground black pepper
2  avocados, halved lengthwise and thinly sliced
directions:
Step 1. Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly coat a 13- x 9-inch baking dish with cooking spray.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 2. Heat a large skillet over medium-high. Add chorizo, and cook, stirring to break up meat into small pieces, until browned, about 8 minutes. Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate. Do not wipe skillet clean.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 3. Add bell pepper and poblano to drippings in skillet; cook over medium, stirring occasionally, until softened, about 5 minutes. Remove skillet from heat.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 4. Whisk together eggs, half-and-half, garlic salt, onion powder, black pepper, and chili powder in a large bowl until fully combined. Stir in sausage, bell pepper and poblano, and cheeses until well combined.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 5. Spread hashbrowns in an even layer in prepared baking dish. Pour egg mixture over hashbrowns, pressing to fully submerge hash browns.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 6. Bake in preheated oven until eggs are set in center and top is golden brown, 40 to 45 minutes. Let stand for 10 minutes. Top evenly with avocado slices. Sprinkle evenly with scallions.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

name: Strawberries and Cream Oatmeal
directions: Step 1. Place 3/4 cup strawberries, milk, water, brown sugar, and salt in a blender cup and blend until smooth.
Step 2. Place oatmeal and strawberry mixture in a saucepan. Bring to a boil, reduce the heat, add remaining strawberries, and simmer until thick, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat; stir in vanilla.

name: Crêpes Suzette
ingredients: ¼ cup unsalted butter, melted, divided
¼ cup unsalted butter, cut into pieces
1 tablespoon orange liqueur (such as Grand Marnier)
¼ cup orange liqueur (such as Grand Marnier)
½ cup vanilla ice cream, or to taste
directions: Step 1. To make the crêpes: Combine milk, water, eggs, sugar, and salt in a blender; blend on medium speed until smooth, about 10 seconds. Add flour and blend until smooth, about 5 more seconds. Add 2 tablespoons of the melted butter and orange zest; pulse until incorporated, about 3 (1-second) pulses. Cover blender and place in refrigerator; let rest for 15 minutes.

Step 2. Remove crêpe batter from fridge. Heat a 6-inch nonstick skillet or crêpe pan over medium heat. Add 1/2 teaspoon of the melted butter and swirl to coat skillet. Add 2 tablespoons batter and swirl to coat bottom of skillet. Cook, undisturbed, until the bottom is lightly golden, and the top is still a little moist, about 1 minute. Swirl skillet to loosen crêpe and gently flip with a spatula and your fingers. Cook until golden, about 30 seconds. Transfer to a plate. Repeat with remaining butter and batter.

Step 3. To make the orange sauce: Combine orange juice, white sugar, and orange zest in a small skillet over medium heat. Cook, stirring often, until sugar is dissolved and the liquid starts to bubble, 3 to 4 minutes. Gradually add butter, piece by piece, stirring constantly, until it is melted and fully incorporated. Let sauce come back up to a simmer and let simmer until slightly syrupy, stirring occasionally, about 2 to 3 minutes. Stir in orange liqueur and salt. Remove from the heat.

Step 4. Fold each crêpe in half, then half again to make a triangle. Dip the folded crêpes into the hot orange sauce. Place on a serving platter. Repeat with remaining crêpes, overlapping each crêpe so they are facing the same direction.

Step 5. To serve, pour orange liqueur into the skillet with the remaining orange sauce and place over medium-high. If it does not ignite automatically, use a long-stemmed lighter and carefully set the liqueur on fire. Let it burn for about 30 seconds. Pour the flaming liqueur over the crêpes on the platter and serve immediately with ice cream.

name: Chocolate Chip Pancakes
ingredients: ½ cup mini chocolate chips, or more to taste
directions: Step 1. To make the buttermilk: Combine milk and vinegar in a bowl and set aside for 5 minutes to sour the milk.
Step 2. Combine flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt in a large mixing bowl.

Step 3. Whisk egg, butter, and vanilla extract into buttermilk mixture until well combined; add flour mixture and whisk until just combined. Fold in chocolate chips. The pancake batter will be thick. Allow batter to rest for 5 minutes.
Step 4. Heat a large skillet over medium-low heat, and coat with cooking spray.

Step 5. Pour about ¼ cup of batter for each pancake onto the skillet. Cook until bubbles appear on the surface, 2 to 4 minutes. Flip pancake with a spatula, and cook until browned on the other side, 2 to 3 more minutes. Repeat with remaining batter. Serve immediately.

name: Banana Chocolate Chip Muffins
directions: Step 1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 12-cup muffin tin or line cups with paper liners.
Step 2. Combine flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt in a large bowl.

Step 3. Mix oil, yogurt, egg, and vanilla together in a separate bowl until well combined; stir into flour mixture until smooth. Gently fold in mashed bananas and chocolate chips. Spoon batter into the prepared muffin cups, filling each 2/3 full.

Step 4. Bake in the preheated oven until tops spring back when lightly pressed, about 22 to 25 minutes. Cool briefly in the tin, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.
I like to adapt this muffin recipe for adults by adding chopped nuts or dried apricots.

name: Coffee Creamer French Toast
directions: Step 1. Whisk egg, coffee creamer, brown sugar, cinnamon, vanilla, and salt together in a shallow dish until foamy and smooth; set aside.
Step 2. Melt butter in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat.
Step 3. Soak each slice of bread in egg mixture, 5 to 7 seconds per side. Place bread into the skillet, cook until golden brown on both sides, 3 to 4 minutes per side.
Step 4. Serve immediately. If desired, top with whipped cream, a dash of cinnamon, and caramel sauce.

name: Orange Cinnamon Rolls
ingredients: ¾ cup warm whole milk (110 degrees F (43 degrees C))
1 ½ teaspoons freshly grated orange zest
¼ cup freshly squeezed orange juice
3 ½ cups all-purpose flour, divided, or more as needed
1 ½ teaspoons freshly grated orange zest
directions:
Step 1. Pour warmed milk into the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment for the dough. Sprinkle yeast evenly over the surface of the milk. Let stand until foamy, 5 to 10 minutes.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 2. Add egg and egg yolk, butter, honey, orange zest, and orange juice to the yeast mixture. Beat on low until combined, about 45 seconds. Add 2 cups flour; beat on low until a wet dough forms, about 1 minute. Turn off mixer; switch to the dough hook attachment. Add 1 ½ cups flour and salt, beat on medium until dough is soft and elastic, 7 to 10 minutes. If necessary, add an additional ½ cup flour, tablespoon by tablespoon, using as little as possible to achieve a soft dough. The dough should be quite sticky.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 3. Gather dough into a ball and transfer to a large greased bowl. Cover with plastic wrap and set aside to rise at room temperature until doubled in size, about 1 hour.
Dotdash Meredith Food StudiosDotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 4. To make the filling: Combine butter, brown sugar, cinnamon, and orange zest in a bowl. Mix with a spatula until smooth and creamy, about 1 minute. Set aside.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 5. Grease a 13x9-inch baking dish; set aside. Punch down the dough and transfer to a well-floured surface. Roll dough into a large 10x18-inch rectangle. Spread the filling over the surface of the dough, leaving a ½ inch border along the top long edge.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 6. Roll the dough away from you to create a log, and pinch seam to seal.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 7. Cut dough log into 12 equal rolls (about 1 ½ inches wide). Transfer rolls to prepared baking dish. Loosely cover with plastic wrap, and set aside to rise at room temperature until puffy and almost doubled in size, 30 to 45 minutes.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios
Step 8. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Step 9. Bake rolls in the preheated oven until golden brown, 22 to 25 minutes.

Step 10. While rolls are baking, prepare the frosting. Combine cream cheese, powdered sugar, orange zest, orange zest, and salt in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment. Beat at medium-high speed until very smooth and creamy, 2 to 3 minutes.

Step 11. Remove rolls from oven and transfer to a wire rack. Let cool 2 minutes, then spread frosting evenly over the rolls. Serve warm.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

name: Asparagus and Eggs
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
directions: Step 1. Heat a small skillet over medium-high heat. Add olive oil and garlic; cook and stir until garlic is fragrant, about 30 seconds.
Step 2. Add asparagus and cook until fork-tender, turning asparagus often to ensure even cooking, about 4 minutes.
Step 3. Spread asparagus out and crack 2 eggs over the asparagus. Cover with lid and cook until egg whites are firm and yolk is done to desired consistency, about 4 minutes.
Step 4. Season with salt and pepper; sprinkle with red pepper flakes and serve immediately.

name: Our Most Saved Brunch Recipe of All Time
Mexican Oatmeal
directions: Step 1. Bring water and cinnamon stick to a boil in a saucepan. Reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes.
Step 2. Add oats and cook for 1 minute. Add milk and cook until thickened, 1 to 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in piloncillo, cinnamon, and vanilla.

name: The Ultimate Brunch Casserole
directions:
Step 1. Gather all ingredients.
Allrecipes / Maren Ellingboe King

Step 2. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Grease a 9-by-13-inch baking dish. Spread hash browns over the bottom of the baking dish.
Allrecipes / Maren Ellingboe King

Step 3. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add chorizo and onion, using a flat wooden spoon to break up the meat into smaller pieces. Cook until browned, about 8 to 10 minutes. Set aside.
Allrecipes / Maren Ellingboe King

Step 4. Whisk eggs, 2 cups Cheddar cheese, 1 cup sour cream, milk, salt, and pepper in a large bowl. Stir in chorizo mixture.
Allrecipes / Maren Ellingboe King

Step 5. Pour egg mixture over hash browns in baking dish. Dollop remaining 1/2 cup sour cream over eggs, and sprinkle with remaining 1 cup cheese.
Allrecipes / Maren Ellingboe King

Step 6. Bake for 35 to 45 minutes, until just set in the center. Sprinkle with green onions, avocado, and pickled jalapeños, if using. Cut into squares and serve immediately.
Allrecipes / Maren Ellingboe King

name: Easy McGriddle Casserole
ingredients: 3 cups complete (“just add water”) pancake mix
directions: Step 1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a 9x13-inch baking dish.
Step 2. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir sausage in the hot skillet until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes. Drain and discard grease. Set aside to cool slightly.

Step 3. Place bacon in a large skillet and cook over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned and crisp, about 10 minutes. Drain bacon slices on paper towels. Crumble when cool enough to handle.

Step 4. Whisk together pancake mix and water until well combined. Stir in maple syrup. Add sausage, bacon, and cheese and fold the mixture together until well incorporated. Pour mixture into prepared baking dish.
Step 5. Bake in the preheated oven until casserole is lightly browned, and a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean, about 30 minutes.
Step 6. Spread butter over hot casserole and serve with extra syrup as desired.

name: Breakfast Burrito with Potatoes and Chorizo
directions: Step 1. Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add chorizo, poblano pepper, onions, and red bell pepper. Cook until vegetables are tender, 5 to 7 minutes. Remove skillet from heat.
Step 2. In a microwave-safe bowl, cook potatoes with a small amount of water until fork tender, 7 to 10 minutes, stirring halfway through; drain. Stir potatoes into chorizo mixture.
Step 3. Meanwhile, whisk eggs, half-and-half, salt, and pepper together in a large bowl.
Step 4. Heat butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add egg mixture and scramble until eggs are cooked, about 3 minutes. Remove eggs from heat. Fold in cheese.

Step 5. Spoon chorizo mixture in a line across the middle of a tortilla, then add a layer of scrambled eggs. Fold opposing edges of the tortilla to overlap the filling. Roll 1 of the opposing edges around the filling creating a burrito.

name: Uova in Purgatorio (Eggs in Purgatory)
ingredients: 3  black Italian olives, pitted and chopped, or more to taste
directions: Step 1. Heat oil in a skillet over low heat. Add garlic, olives, capers, and anchovy; cook for 1 to 2 minutes. Add tomato sauce and water, bring to a boil, and simmer until flavors combine, about 10 minutes. Add parsley and season with salt.
Step 2. Gently add eggs directly into tomato sauce without breaking the yolks. Cook until eggs are just cooked, 3 to 5 minutes.

name: Orange French Toast Bake
ingredients: 1 tablespoon confectioners sugar, or as needed (optional)
2 tablespoons maple syrup, or as needed
directions: Step 1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Lightly grease two large baking sheets or line with parchment paper, lightly sprayed with cooking spray, which will keep the bread from sticking.
Step 2. In a bowl, whisk eggs until light in color. Add milk, sugar, orange liqueur, orange juice, orange zest, orange extract, salt, and nutmeg, whisking until well combined.
Step 3. Coat bread slices in the egg custard, and place on the baking sheets without overlapping. Bake until golden brown, flipping halfway through baking time, about 15 minutes.

Step 4. To serve, sprinkle with confectioners sugar and drizzle with maple syrup.
Other recommendations for breads would be brioche or challah.

name: Croissant French Toast Bake
directions:
Step 1. Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Generously coat a 9x13-inch baking dish with nonstick cooking spray.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 2. Whisk together eggs, milk, heavy cream, brown sugar, vanilla, cinnamon, and salt in a large bowl.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 3. Dip each croissant half in the egg mixture until fully soaked.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 4. Arrange dipped croissants in the prepared baking dish, overlapping as needed. Pour any remaining egg mixture over croissants.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 5. Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown and a knife inserted in the center comes out clean, about 30 minutes.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 6. Let stand 15 minutes before serving. Serve with desired toppings.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

name: 20 Top-Rated Breakfast Casseroles for Your 9x13 Dish
Baked Skillet Pancake
ingredients: 1 tablespoon confectioner's sugar, or to taste
directions: Step 1. Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Place a large cast iron skillet in the oven while preheating.
Step 2. Add butter to skillet to melt a few minutes before preheating is complete.
Step 3. Whisk flour and milk together in a bowl. Whisk in eggs. Batter will be slightly lumpy.
Step 4. Carefully remove skillet from oven; pour batter into the hot skillet over melted butter.
Step 5. Return to the oven and bake until lightly golden and crispy around edges, 10 to 15 minutes.
Step 6. Dust with confectioner’s sugar and cinnamon, as desired, while still warm.

name: Cheesecake Pancakes
ingredients: 8 ounces fresh strawberries, hulled and chopped
Graham cracker crumbs or powdered sugar for topping
directions:
Step 1. Gather all ingredients.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 2. For topping, combine strawberries and jam in a small saucepan. Bring to a simmer; set aside.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 3. For cream cheese swirl, combine cream cheese, 3 tablespoons sugar, milk, and vanilla in a small bowl. Beat with an electric mixer until smooth.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 4. Transfer cream cheese mixture to a pastry bag or a resealable plastic bag with a corner snipped off. 
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 5. For pancake batter, combine flour, remaining 2 tablespoons sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt in a large bowl.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 6. Combine egg, buttermilk, and oil in a medium bowl.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 7. Add egg mixture all at once to the flour mixture. Stir just until moistened (batter should be slightly lumpy).
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 8. Heat an extra-large nonstick skillet or griddle over medium heat. Coat with cooking spray. Pour 1/3 cup portions of batter onto the skillet. Reduce heat to medium-low.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios
Step 9. Cook until bottoms are golden brown and edges are slightly dry and bubbles form at the edges of the pancakes, 2 to 3 minutes.

Step 10. Pipe a swirl of cream cheese onto each pancake starting from the center.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 11. Coat the uncooked side of the pancakes with cooking spray.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 12. Turn and cook 2 to 3 minutes more on the other side. Repeat with remaining batter and cream cheese mixture.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 13. Serve with strawberry topping and sprinkle with graham cracker crumbs or dust with powdered sugar.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

name: Perfect Pancakes
ingredients: 1 tablespoon butter, softened, or as needed, for greasing, plus more for serving
toppings of choice, e.g. maple syrup or fruit, for serving  toppings of choice, e.g. maple syrup or fruit, for serving
directions: Step 1. Preheat a griddle to 300 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Step 2. Stir together milk and vinegar in a small bowl or a 4-cup liquid measuring cup.
Step 3. Whisk together flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt in a second bowl.

Step 4. Beat eggs in a large bowl until smooth. Add vanilla and milk mixture; whisk together. Add flour mixture to bowl with egg mixture and whisk until just combined. (Batter will be lumpy.) Let rest 3 minutes and gently stir again.

Step 5. Melt some butter on the griddle, then carefully wipe with a paper towel. (You want just a bit of a sheen; don’t overgrease the griddle.) Spoon batter in 1/3-cup portions onto griddle. Cook until bubbles form on surface of batter, about 2 1/2 minutes.
Step 6. Flip pancakes and cook until browned on the other side, about 1 1/2 minutes more. Repeat with remaining batter. Serve immediately with butter and toppings.

name: Hash Brown and Bacon Omelet Cups
ingredients: 3 cups frozen shredded hash brown potatoes, thawed
directions: Step 1. Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Grease 12 (2 1/2-inch) muffin cups with cooking spray.

Step 2. Wrap hash browns in a clean kitchen towel and squeeze to remove as much moisture as possible. Stir together hash browns, melted butter, salt, and black pepper in a large bowl. Press about 1/4 cup of the hash brown mixture into bottom and up the sides of each prepared muffin cup.
Step 3. Bake in the preheated oven until lightly browned, 18 to 20 minutes.
Step 4. Meanwhile, stir together cheese, eggs, bell pepper, and crushed red pepper (if using) in a bowl.

Step 5. Remove muffin tin from the oven. Reduce oven temperature to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Top hash browns with half of the bacon. Top with egg mixture and remaining bacon. Bake until a knife inserted into centers comes out clean, 13 to 15 minutes. Garnish with chives.

name: Tortilla Scrambled Egg and Cheese
directions: Step 1. Whisk egg and milk together in a small bowl.

Step 2. Melt butter in a skillet over medium heat. Pour in egg mixture and tilt skillet until egg covers the skillet. Cook until egg is set, about 2 minutes. Place flour tortilla over egg, and carefully flip egg and tortilla so that the tortilla is now on the bottom.
Step 3. Place cheese slices over egg. Cook until tortilla is crisp, 3 to 4 minutes. Cover skillet and cook until cheese is melted, 1 to 2 minutes.

name: Fried Egg Tortilla
ingredients: 1/4 teaspoon taco seasoning, or to taste
directions: Step 1. In a 10-inch nonstick skillet, melt butter over medium heat, and swirl the pan to coat the bottom evenly.
Step 2. Carefully break egg into buttered skillet and cook until egg white is opaque and egg is firm enough to turn, about 1 minute.
Step 3. Turn egg over, being careful not to break yolk; sprinkle with taco seasoning and about half of cheese.
Step 4. Gently place tortilla over egg and cheese, and cook about 1 minute. Using a silicone egg turner, flip the egg and tortilla, as one.
Step 5. Sprinkle remaining cheese on top of the egg, and continue cooking until the egg is done to your liking and the tortilla is warm and toasty, about 2 minutes.
Step 6. Slide tortilla and egg to a serving plate and serve warm.

name: Halloumi and Zucchini Frittata
ingredients: 1 large zucchini, grated and squeezed dry
salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
directions: Step 1. Heat olive oil in a small, ovenproof skillet over medium heat. Add zucchini and a pinch of salt and cook until soft, about 5 minutes. Add chopped mint and dill, and cook 1 minute more.

Step 2. Beat eggs with salt and pepper in a small bowl. Pour into the hot skillet with the zucchini and briefly stir. Cook without stirring to allow the bottom of the frittata to set, about 2 minutes. Use a spatula around the edges of the skillet to ensure that the frittata isn't sticking as the bottom starts to set.
Step 3. Set an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler.

Step 4. Lay the slices of halloumi on the top of the frittata as the edges start to set. Place the skillet under the broiler until the top of the frittata is fully set and cheese is slightly browned, about 5 minutes. Serve immediately or at room temperature.

name: Bacon, Egg, and Cheese Sandwich
directions: Step 1. Place bacon in a nonstick skillet and cook over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned, about 7 minutes. Drain bacon slices on paper towels. Remove bacon to a drip line tray. Drain off bacon grease for another use. Wash out the skillet.
Step 2. Whisk eggs with salt and pepper in a small bowl until frothy.

Step 3. Melt 2 teaspoons butter in the nonstick skillet over medium heat. Pour in beaten eggs; let cook for 30 seconds. Lift the edges of the omelet so that the uncooked egg runs under the cooked edges and comes into contact with the hot skillet. Shake and tilt the skillet to move the uncooked egg. Repeat until the top is set, about 3 minutes; reduce heat to low.
Step 4. Meanwhile, chop bacon roughly; sprinkle over omelet. Sprinkle with cheese; allow cheese to melt, 1 to 2 minutes.

Step 5. Meanwhile, butter 2 slices of bread with 1/2 teaspoon butter each. Lay bread, buttered side up, side-by-side over omelet, leaving about 1 inch between slices. The melted cheese will help the bread adhere.

Step 6. Run a spatula around the entire omelet to loosen from the skillet. Carefully turn the omelet over so buttered side of bread is in contact with the skillet. Cook until bread is toasted and golden, about 2 minutes.

Step 7. Using the spatula, fold in edges of omelet to align with sides of the bread. Cut omelet along center with the spatula to form 2 sandwiches. Butter 2 remaining bread slices with remaining butter; place butter side up on each sandwich. Turn sandwiches; cook until golden, about 2 minutes more. Serve and enjoy immediately!
thedailygourmet

name: Air Fryer Spinach, Pepper, and Feta Egg Bites
ingredients: 1/4 cup feta cheese, plus more for garnish
1 tablespoon green onion, plus more for garnish
directions: Step 1. Coat 4 (6-ounces) ramekins with cooking spray.

Step 2. Stir together eggs, milk, salt, and black pepper in a bowl. In another bowl, stir together spinach, bell pepper, feta, and green onion; spoon into prepared ramekins. Evenly pour egg mixture over filling in ramekins.
Step 3. Preheat air fryer to 340 degrees F (160 degrees C). Arrange ramekins in air fryer basket.

Step 4. Cook for about 6 minutes. Gently stir partially cooked egg bites. Cook until eggs are set, 12 to 14 minutes more. Let egg bites stand about 3 minutes before serving. Garnish with additional feta and green onion.

name: Tres Leches Pancakes
ingredients: 1 (15.25 oz) box French vanilla cake mix
1/2 cup whipped cream, or as needed (optional) whipped cream, or as needed (optional)
1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon, or as needed (optional)
directions: Step 1. Combine sweetened condensed milk, evaporated milk, and half and half in a small saucepan and set over medium heat. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly for 3 to 4 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool. This is a sauce, not a syrup, so consistency will be on the thinner side.
Step 2. Add cake mix, almond milk, eggs, and 3 tablespoons vegetable oil to a large bowl, and beat vigorously by hand for 2 minutes.

Step 3. Heat a large skillet or griddle over medium heat, and lightly coat with remaining vegetable oil. Add 1/4 cup of the batter for each pancake. Cook until edges begin to puff up, small bubbles appear, pop, and leave small holes, 2 to 3 minutes. Flip pancakes and cook until golden brown on the other side, about 2 minutes more.
Step 4. Serve pancakes warm with a drizzle of the tres leches sauce, a dollop of whipped cream, and sprinkle of cinnamon.

name: Breakfast Burrito Bowl
directions:
Step 1. Gather all ingredients.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios
Step 2. Preheat an air fryer to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C) for 10 minutes, or according to manufacturer's instructions.

Step 3. Line the air fryer basket with aluminum foil. Add bacon slices in a single layer and cook until crispy, about 8 minutes.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 4. Remove from the air fryer and set aside on a paper towel-lined plate. Reduce temperature to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Spray 2 large ramekins or heatproof bowls with cooking spray, and press one tortilla inside each bowl with the edges coming up and out.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 5. Crack 2 eggs into each tortilla shell, then top each with 1/4 cup cheese. Sprinkle each with 1/8 teaspoon adobo seasoning and 1/8 teaspoon salt. 
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 6. Working with one tortilla bowl at a time, cook in the air fryer until tortillas are crispy, egg whites are set, and yolks are runny, 13 to 15 minutes.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 7. While tortillas cook, stir together cherry tomatoes, cilantro, scallions, lime juice, remaining 1/2 teaspoon adobo seasoning, and remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt in a small bowl. Break bacon into small pieces, and set aside.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 8. Remove tortillas from bowls and place on a plate. Top bowls evenly with tomato mixture, avocado, and bacon.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

name: Peanut Butter Oatmeal
directions: Step 1. Combine milk, sugar, and salt in a saucepan over medium-low heat and bring to a simmer.
Step 2. Add cinnamon and oats. Cook over medium-low heat until oats are tender with a bite, about 5 minutes. Use a long spoon to stir, and adjust heat to prevent splattering.
Step 3. Remove from heat; stir in vanilla and peanut butter. Serve in a large bowl, and top with honey and walnuts.

name: Asparagus and Eggs
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
directions: Step 1. Heat a small skillet over medium-high heat. Add olive oil and garlic; cook and stir until garlic is fragrant, about 30 seconds.
Step 2. Add asparagus and cook until fork-tender, turning asparagus often to ensure even cooking, about 4 minutes.
Step 3. Spread asparagus out and crack 2 eggs over the asparagus. Cover with lid and cook until egg whites are firm and yolk is done to desired consistency, about 4 minutes.
Step 4. Season with salt and pepper; sprinkle with red pepper flakes and serve immediately.

name: Teriyaki Salmon Bowl
directions: Step 1. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C) and spray a baking dish with cooking spray.
Step 2. Combine soy sauce, brown sugar, garlic, and ginger in a small bowl. Place the salmon in the prepared baking dish, skin side down. Pour teriyaki sauce over.
Step 3. Bake in the preheated oven until fish flakes easily with a fork, 12 to 15 minutes.

Step 4. Place rice in a bowl, top with salmon, and spoon over teriyaki sauce from the baking dish. Add in the shredded cabbage, grated carrots, and radishes. Sprinkle with sliced green onions and sesame seeds, to garnish.

name: Meatless Grain Bowl
ingredients: 1 large sweet potato, peeled and cubed
3 tablespoons coconut oil or vegetable oil, or as needed, divided
1 (15 ounce) can black beans, drained and rinsed
1 teaspoon jerk seasoning, or to taste
directions: Step 1. Bring water and rice to a boil in a saucepan. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until rice is tender and water has been absorbed, 20 to 25 minutes. Keep warm.
Step 2. Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).
Step 3. Toss cubed sweet potatoes in 1 tablespoon oil. Spread evenly on a baking sheet.
Step 4. Roast sweet potatoes in the preheated oven until tender but not too soft, 15 to 20 minutes.
Step 5. Heat a cast iron skillet with 1 tablespoon coconut oil over medium-high heat; add red, green, and orange bell peppers and saute for 2 to 3 minutes. Remove from the skillet and set aside.

Step 6. Add remaining 1 tablespoon coconut oil to the same skillet. Add tofu evenly. Cook for 2 minutes and gently flip to the other side. Continue cooking, turning occasionally, until tofu gets a little crisp on the edges, 6 to 8 minutes.
Step 7. Add jerk marinade, being deliberate about making sure tofu is covered. Once tofu starts to caramelize from the marinade, remove from heat.
Step 8. Warm black beans in a microwave-safe dish until hot, 2 to 3 minutes, stirring every 30 seconds.
Step 9. Assemble grain bowls: divide rice, tofu, peppers, sweet potatoes, and black beans evenly into individual serving bowls.

name: Miso Noodle Soup in a Jar
directions: Step 1. Cut tofu into 1/2-inch planks. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook tofu, turning halfway through, until golden, 6 to 8 minutes. Cut tofu into cubes.
Step 2. Stir together green onions, miso paste, garlic, stock base, and ginger in a small bowl. Divide evenly among 3 microwave-safe pint-size canning jars with lids.

Step 3. Layer evenly with rice vermicelli noodles, tofu, mushrooms, and bok choy. Chill, covered, up to 5 days. To serve, see “Heat and Eat”. Garnish with sliced green onions.
Let jar stand at room temperature 10 minutes or run under warm water 1 minute. Add water (about 1 cup) to ingredients in jar until nearly full. Microwave without the lid for 3 minutes. Carefully screw on lid (jar will be very hot). Let stand 5 minutes. Invert jar to combine ingredients. Eat out of jar or transfer to a bowl to serve.Allrecipes Magazine

name: Arugula Salad with Stone Fruit
ingredients: 1 cup Rainier or other yellow-flesh cherries, Rainier or other yellow-flesh cherries, pitted and halved
directions: Step 1. Whisk together olive oil, vinegar, salt, and pepper in a small bowl for the dressing.
Step 2. Arrange tomatoes, arugula, basil, nectarines, and peach slices on a large platter. Drizzle with half the dressing. Top with cherries, sea salt, and remaining dressing. Serve immediately.

name: Simple Salami Sandwich
ingredients: 2 teaspoons sliced green olives with pimiento
directions: Step 1. Place bottom bun on a plate and spread mustard over the bun. Top with salami, cheese, tomato, and lettuce leaf.
Step 2. Combine black olives, green olives, and salad dressing in a bowl. Place mixture on top of the lettuce. Top with remaining half of bun. Serve immediately.

name: Salami, Ham, and Pepperoni Sandwiches in the Air Fryer
directions: Step 1. Place mushrooms in the basket of the air fryer. Set air fryer to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) and cook mushroom slices for 5 minutes.
Step 2. Spread 1 tablespoon pesto onto the bottom half of the hoagie bun. Arrange salami slices over the pesto. Add ham and pepperoni.

Step 3. Place 1 slice of cheese over the ham and pepperoni. Top with mushrooms and olives. Add remaining slice of cheese. Spread remaining tablespoon of pesto on the other half of the bun and place on top to complete the sandwich.
Step 4. Place entire sandwich in the basket of the air fryer. Cook until cheese has melted and salami is crisp, about 5 minutes.

name: Old Fashioned Pea Salad
ingredients: salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Step 1. Combine peas, onion, hard-cooked eggs, and mayonnaise in a large bowl. Stir well to combine. Season with salt and pepper. Chill for one hour before serving.

name: Egg Butter
directions: Step 1. Place the eggs into a saucepan in a single layer and fill with water to cover the eggs by 1 inch. Cover the saucepan and bring the water to a boil over high heat. Once the water is boiling, remove from the heat and let the eggs stand in the hot water for 15 minutes. Cool the eggs under cold running water. Peel, and remove yolks from white. Chop yolks; reserve whites for another use.
Step 2. Beat butter in a large bowl until soft and fluffy. Mix in the egg yolks, cayenne pepper, and Worcestershire sauce. Beat until smooth.

name: Cucumber Soup with Tomatoes
directions: Step 1. Place 2 cucumbers in a blender; pour in chicken stock. Blend cucumber mixture until smooth and pureed; pour cucumber puree into a large bowl.
Step 2. Chop the remaining 2 cucumbers. Stir chopped cucumbers, tomato, lime juice, and cayenne pepper into pureed cucumber until well mixed. Refrigerate until chilled, at least 30 minutes.

name: Sugar Salad
ingredients: 1 head green leaf lettuce, torn into bite-size pieces
directions: Step 1. Whisk the vegetable oil, vinegar, and sugar in a small bowl. Place the lettuce in a large bowl. Drizzle the oil mixture over the lettuce and toss to coat.

name: Yeast Dumplings
directions: Step 1. Place milk and butter in a small saucepan, and simmer over medium heat until butter melts. Remove from the heat and allow to cool.
Step 2. Dissolve the yeast in the warm water placed in a small bowl. Set aside.

Step 3. Combine the eggs, sugar, and salt in a large mixing bowl, and mix until thoroughly blended. Gradually stir in the flour, alternating with milk and yeast mixtures. Gather the dough into a ball. Cover the bowl with a cloth, and let the dough rest 20 minutes.
Step 4. Pour the chicken broth into a large pot. Bring broth to a boil over medium-high heat.

Step 5. Meanwhile, sprinkle flour over a clean board or countertop. Turn the dough out onto the board and knead lightly until smooth and satiny, about 3 minutes. Add a little more flour if the dough is sticky. Roll out the dough to be about 1/2 inch thick. Use a butter knife to cut dough into 2 inch wide strips, and place strips into the boiling broth. Dumplings will initially sink, then rise to the surface when cooked, about 10 minutes. Remove dumplings from the broth with a slotted spoon, and drain on a plate.

name: Po' Boy Remoulade Sauce
ingredients: 3 tablespoons Creole or spicy brown mustard
⅛ teaspoon freshly squeezed lemon juice
1 pinch cayenne pepper, or to taste
salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Step 1. Mix mayonnaise, mustard, ketchup, chives, parsley, garlic, Worcestershire sauce, lemon juice, paprika, cayenne, salt, and pepper together until well combined.

name: The Ultimate Pasta Salad
ingredients: 1 (16 ounce) package uncooked tri-colored spiral pasta
1 head fresh broccoli, cut into bite size pieces
1 head fresh cauliflower, chopped into bite size pieces
8 ounces pepperoni slices, cut into quarters
1 (8 ounce) package mozzarella cheese, cut into cubes
1 (6 ounce) can large pitted black olives, drained and sliced
½ cup olive oil, or to taste
½ cup red wine vinegar, or to taste
directions: Step 1. Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Place pasta in the pot; cook until al dente, 8 to 10 minutes. Drain and transfer to a bowl. Cover and chill in the refrigerator for 1 hour.

Step 2. Toss chilled pasta with broccoli, cauliflower, red onion, garlic, pepperoni, mozzarella cheese, olives, olive oil, and red wine vinegar. Season with salt, pepper, and Italian seasoning. Chill in the refrigerator until serving.

name: Tomato Gorgonzola Soup
ingredients: ½ cup red bell pepper, diced
directions: Step 1. Heat oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add the onion, pepper, and garlic; cook and stir 4 to 5 minutes or until vegetables are soft.
Step 2. Add the cheeses, cream, and milk; heat mixture until cheeses melt and the mixture is simmering.
Step 3. Stir in the tomatoes (including their liquid), tomato juice, basil, sugar, and pepper. Continue to simmer mixture for 15 to 20 minutes while stirring constantly. Do not boil.

name: ESER's Balsamic Salad Dressing
ingredients: 1 tablespoon honey, or more to taste
salt and ground black pepper to taste
⅓ cup olive oil, or more as needed
directions: Step 1. Combine balsamic vinegar, honey, mustard, garlic, oregano, salt, and black pepper in a food processor. Turn the food processor on; pour olive oil in a steady stream into balsamic vinegar mixture until salad dressing is thick and creamy.

name: Belizean Chicken Stew
ingredients: 2 pounds skinless, boneless chicken breast halves
1 dash hot sauce (such as Marie Sharp's Belizean Habanero Sauce), or to taste
salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Step 1. Heat olive oil in a large Dutch oven over medium heat. Season chicken with seasoned salt. Cook chicken in the hot oil until browned on the outside, about 5 minutes per side.

Step 2. Mix chicken broth, cabbage, onion, carrots, green bell pepper, celery, cilantro, tomato sauce, lime juice, garlic, hot sauce, salt, and black pepper into chicken and simmer, adding water if needed, until stew is thickened, about 2 hours.
Step 3. Ladle stew into bowls and top each with a piece of chicken.

name: Pizza Salad
ingredients: 1 head iceberg lettuce, torn into bite-sized pieces
½ pound salami, cut into strips
½ cup pitted black olives, halved
directions: Step 1. Combine lettuce, salami, mozzarella cheese, Cheddar cheese, tomato, olives, and chives in a large bowl. Mix well to combine.
Step 2. Make dressing: Whisk together tomato sauce, oil, vinegar, sugar, oregano, salt, garlic powder, and pepper in a medium bowl.
Step 3. Pour enough dressing over lettuce mixture to coat; toss and serve.

name: Fruity Chili
ingredients: 2 (15 ounce) cans kidney beans, rinsed and drained
directions: Step 1. Combine the tomato sauce, kidney beans, 2 tablespoons chili powder, 1 tablespoon sugar, and cayenne pepper in a large sauce pan; bring to a simmer over low heat.

Step 2. Place a large skillet over medium-high heat; place the ground beef in the skillet; season with 2 tablespoons chili powder, 1 tablespoon sugar, and the cayenne pepper; cook until brown; add to the sauce mixture.

Step 3. Heat the oil in a small skillet over medium-high heat; cook the onion in the oil until slightly browned; add to the sauce mixture, along with the apple, peach, and banana pepper. Allow to simmer another 1 to 2 minutes until hot.

name: Summer Pepper Salad
ingredients: 1  green bell pepper, seeded and chopped
1  red bell pepper, seeded and chopped
1  yellow bell pepper, seeded and chopped
directions: Step 1. In a large bowl, mix the green bell pepper, red bell pepper, yellow bell pepper, cucumber, parsley, feta cheese, and olive oil. Chill at least 30 minutes in the refrigerator before serving.

name: Hawaiian Ham and Cheese Sliders
ingredients: 2 teaspoons Worcestershire sauce, or more to taste
1 (12 count) package Hawaiian sweet rolls, split, or more as needed
1 pound sliced deli ham, or more as needed
8 slices Swiss cheese, or more as needed
directions:
Step 1. Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spray a 9x13-inch baking dish with cooking spray.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 2. Melt butter in a saucepan over medium-low heat; cook and stir onion in the melted butter until softened, 5 to 10 minutes. Add mustard, poppy seeds, and Worcestershire sauce; cook and stir for 5 minutes.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 3. Arrange the roll bottoms in the prepared baking dish. Spoon 2/3 of the onion mixture over top.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 4. Add ham and cheese to each roll.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 5. Place the roll tops over the cheese layer, then brush the remaining onion mixture over top.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 6. Cover the dish with aluminum foil.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 7. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Remove aluminum foil and bake until the roll tops are lightly browned, 5 to 10 minutes.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

name: Taco Bell Seasoning Copycat
directions:
Step 1. Gather all ingredients.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 2. Whisk together onion flakes, flour, bouillon granules, garlic salt, cumin, paprika, chili powder, cayenne pepper, and sugar in a bowl.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

name: Japanese Tamago Egg
ingredients: 1/2 teaspoon vegetable oil, or more as needed
directions:
Step 1. Gather all ingredients.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 2. Beat eggs thoroughly in a bowl; whisk in dashi stock, sugar, mirin, and soy sauce until sugar has dissolved. Lightly grease a nonstick skillet and heat over medium heat.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 3. Pour a thin layer of egg mixture into the hot pan and swirl to coat the pan. Cook until egg layer is firm on the bottom but still slightly liquid on top, about 1 minute.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 4. Then lift up one edge using a spatula and roll up the egg layer.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 5. Push omelet roll to one side of the skillet. Oil the skillet again and pour in another thin layer of egg, lifting the first omelet roll up slightly to allow the egg to flow underneath.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 6. Roll up the first omelet in the new layer of egg and push omelet to the edge of the skillet as before.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 7. Repeat the process with the remaining egg mixture, oiling the pan each time if needed.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 8. Remove rolled omelet to a serving platter and cut into 6 equal pieces to serve.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

name: Sicilian Eggplant Caponata
ingredients: 1  eggplant, peeled and cut into ½-inch cubes
1 ½ cups canned plum tomatoes, drained and coarsely chopped
12  green olives, pitted and coarsely chopped
2 teaspoons minced fresh parsley, or to taste
directions:
Step 1. Toss eggplant with salt and place in a colander set over a bowl. Let sit, about 30 minutes. Rinse and pat dry.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 2. Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add celery; cook, stirring often, until softened, about 3 to 4 minutes. Add onion and garlic; cook and stir until onion is soft and lightly golden, about 4 to 5 minutes. Transfer the mixture to a bowl using a slotted spoon.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 3. Heat remaining 2 tablespoons olive oil in the skillet. Add eggplant and cook, stirring constantly, until lightly browned, 5 minutes.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 4. Stir in celery mixture, tomatoes, olives, capers, tomato paste, and oregano. Bring to a boil; reduce heat to low and simmer uncovered until caponata is thickened, about 15 minutes.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios
Step 5. Season caponata with vinegar, sugar, salt, and black pepper. Transfer to a serving bowl and garnish with parsley.

name: Christy's Awesome Hot Ham and Cheese
directions:
Step 1. Gather all ingredients.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios
Step 2. Preheat a skillet over medium-high heat.
Step 3. Spread one side of each slice of bread with 1 teaspoon butter.

Step 4. Place one slice butter-side down in the hot skillet. Top with Swiss cheese and ham.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 5. Spread the unbuttered side of second slice of bread with mayonnaise and mustard; place it butter-side up on sandwich.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios
Step 6. Cook in the hot skillet until golden brown and cheese is melted, about 3 minutes per side.

name: BLT
directions:
Step 1. Gather all ingredients.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 2. Cook bacon in a large, deep skillet over medium-high heat until evenly browned, about 10 minutes. Drain bacon on a paper towel-lined plate.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 3. Arrange cooked bacon, lettuce, and tomato slices on one slice of bread. Spread mayonnaise on the other slice of bread.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 4. Close to make a sandwich.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

name: Olive Cheese Balls
ingredients: cracked black cracked black black pepper, for garnish
directions: Step 1. Combine cheese and butter in a food processor and process until mixed together. Add flour, paprika, and cayenne. Process just until dough comes together. Turn out dough and shape into a disc. Chill, covered, until slightly firm and easy to handle, about 30 minutes.
Step 2. Meanwhile, drain liquid from olives and spread out on paper towels to dry.(The olives should be completely dry before wrapping with dough.)

Step 3. Line a 10x15-inch rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper. Pinch off a piece of dough about the size of a walnut half. Flatten and wrap around an olive, enclosing completely. Roll to make a smooth ball. Place on the prepared baking sheet. Repeat with remaining dough and olives, spacing olive balls about 1 1/2 inches apart. Freeze until firm, at least 1 hour (and up to 1 month).
Step 4. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
Step 5. Bake frozen cheese balls until lightly browned and dough is set, 15 to 18 minutes. Let cool 5 minutes. Serve with ranch and garnish with pepper.

name: Best Smoked Salmon Dip
ingredients: 1  green onion, finely chopped, plus more for garnish
1 tablespoon fresh dill, plus more for garnish
directions: Step 1. Flake smoked salmon with a fork.

Step 2. Beat together cream cheese and mayonnaise in a large bowl with an electric mixer at medium speed until smooth. Add red onion, green onion, capers, lemon juice, dill, and Creole seasoning; mix well. Gently fold in smoked salmon.
Step 3. Chill in an airtight container at least 2 hours (and up to 3 days). Garnish with additional dill and green onions. Serve with crackers and crostini.

name: Smoked Turkey Collard Green Dip
directions: Step 1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Coat a 2-quart baking dish with cooking spray.

Step 2. Beat cream cheese and sour cream together in a large bowl with an electric mixer on medium speed until smooth. Fold in collard greens, turkey, 1 1/2 cups cheese, and hot sauce. Transfer to the prepared baking dish and top with remaining 1 cup cheese.

Step 3. Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is melted and golden brown, 20 to 25 minutes. Garnish with smoked paprika and parsley.
Here are 5 ways to cook collard greens if you don't happen to have leftovers.

name: Beet Pickled Deviled Eggs
ingredients: 1/2 cup apple cider vinegar, or as needed
salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
directions: Step 1. For brine, drain beet juice into a small saucepan; set beet slices aside. Add the 1/2 cup vinegar, sugar, salt, and peppercorns, and bring to a low boil over medium heat, stirring until sugar dissolves, 3 to 5 minutes. Let cool completely, about 20 minutes.

Step 2. Place eggs in a jar or glass bowl just large enough that brine will completely cover eggs; pour in brine. Top up with vinegar as needed to cover eggs completely. Refrigerate, covered, for at least 12 and up to 24 hours. The longer eggs are in brine, the deeper pink they will be.

Step 3. Slice eggs in half lengthwise from top to bottom with a sharp knife. Remove yolks and place in a bowl. Mash yolks with a fork until smooth, and stir in mayonnaise, Dijon, the 1 teaspoon vinegar, and hot sauce; season with salt and pepper. As an option, if you have a small food processor, place all filling ingredients in it, and blend until smooth.

Step 4. Spoon filling evenly into egg whites or add mixture to a piping bag or resealable plastic bag with one corner clipped. Pipe mixture into egg white halves, garnish as desired, and serve.
Here's everything you need to know about how to boil eggs.

name: Cranberry Cheese Ball
ingredients: 1/4 cup pecans, toasted and finely chopped
crackers, crostini, and/or vegetable dippers for serving
directions:
Step 1. Gather all ingredients. 
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 2. Bring cranberry juice just to a boil in a small saucepan. Remove from heat. Add 1/4 cup dried cranberries. Cover; set aside.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 3. Place cream cheese, Cheddar cheese, and butter in a large bowl. Let stand at room temperature for 30 minutes.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 4. Drain cranberries, reserving 1 tablespoon juice. Add plumped cranberries and reserved juice to the bowl with the cheese mixture. Add 1 tablespoon chives, orange zest, brown sugar, and garlic powder. Beat with an electric mixer on medium until light and fluffy. 
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 5. Place cheese mixture on a sheet of plastic wrap. Use the plastic wrap to shape the mixture into a ball (it won’t be a perfect shape at this point). Wrap in the plastic wrap and chill in the refrigerator for 3 to 24 hours.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 6. Now you can make a better ball shape by rolling the wrapped mixture on your work surface.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 7. Sprinkle remaining 1/4 cup dried cranberries, remaining 1 tablespoon chives, and the pecans on a sheet of plastic wrap or waxed paper. Roll cheese ball in the mixture to coat.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 8. Let stand 15 minutes before serving with crackers, crostini, or vegetable dippers.
Dotdash Meredith Food StudiosInstead of refrigerating, place ball in a freezer container and freeze up to 1 month. Thaw in the refrigerator overnight. Roll in coating before serving.

name: Coconut Chicken Tenders
ingredients: 1 pound boneless chicken breast tenderloins or skinless, boneless chicken breasts, cut into 1-inch thick strips
directions:
Step 1. Gather all ingredients. 
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 2. Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Place a wire rack in a 18x13-inch rimmed baking sheet. Coat rack with nonstick cooking spray. Sprinkle chicken tenders with 1/2 teaspoon salt, set aside.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 3. Place flour in a small shallow dish. Whisk together egg and Sriracha in a second shallow dish. Combine panko, shredded coconut, sesame seeds, paprika, garlic powder, and remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt in a third shallow dish. Drizzle panko mixture with olive oil and mix until coated evenly. 
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 4. One at a time, dip chicken  tenders into the flour, shaking off the excess, then dip into the egg mixture to coat. Dredge in the panko mixture, coating all sides and pressing as needed to help it adhere. Place on the prepared rack. Repeat with remaining chicken tenders.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 5. Bake in the preheated oven until chicken is cooked through (165 degrees F or 74 degrees C) internal temperature) and golden brown, about 15 minutes.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 6. In a small bowl mix together mayonnaise, Asian sweet chili sauce, and Sriracha.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 7. Serve chicken tenders hot with dipping sauce and enjoy!
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

name: Truffle Deviled Eggs
directions: Step 1. Halve eggs lengthwise and scoop egg yolks into the bowl of a mini food processor; set egg whites aside. If you do not have a mini food processor, you can mash all ingredients in a bowl with a fork.

Step 2. Add mayonnaise, Dijon mustard, truffle oil, salt, and pepper to the egg yolks; blend well until smooth, scraping down the sides of the bowl. If mixture is too thick, blend in an extra teaspoon or two of mayonnaise.

Step 3. Place yolk mixture into a resealable bag and snip off a corner. Pipe mixture into egg whites. Top with chives and shaved truffle, and refrigerate until ready to serve.
Here's everything you need to know about How to Boil Eggs.

name: Chicken Adobo Tacos
directions: Step 1. Combine soy sauce, vinegar, bay leaves, and garlic in a large plastic bag with a zipper. Gently squeeze to mix well. Add chicken and coat with marinade. Squeeze out as much air from the bag as possible, coat all the chicken pieces with marinade, seal, and refrigerate for at least 20 minutes.

Step 2. Meanwhile, combine vinegar, fish sauce, avocado oil, sugar, and black pepper in a bowl for the salsa. Stir with a whisk or fork until sugar is dissolved. Add mango, tomato, red onion, jalapeño, and chopped cilantro to the bowl. Toss to combine, and refrigerate salsa until ready to serve.
Step 3. For tacos, remove chicken pieces from the marinade and reserve the marinade.
Step 4. Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Carefully add the chicken thighs, and brown on each side, 1 to 2 minutes, then remove chicken to a plate.

Step 5. To the same skillet, add onion, and cook for about 1 minute. Stir in minced garlic and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add reserved marinade, water, brown sugar, and black pepper, and bring to a boil.

Step 6. Return chicken to the skillet, smooth side down. Reduce heat to low, and simmer chicken uncovered, about 15 minutes. The liquid should bubble gently. Turn chicken and simmer 10 minutes more. Remove chicken from skillet to rest.
Step 7. Cook sauce over medium heat until syrupy, thick, and reduced, about 10 minutes. Remove skillet from heat. Remove bay leaves and discard.
Step 8. Slice chicken into 1/2-inch slices and return to the skillet to coat in the sauce. Garnish with fresh cilantro and chopped green onions, if desired.
Step 9. Fill each tortilla with chicken strips and top with mango salsa. Serve immediately.

name: Pigs In A Blanket Wreath
ingredients: 2 (8 ounce) cans refrigerated crescent roll dough
1 (12 ounce) package mini sausages, such as Lil' Smokies®
directions: Step 1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with parchment.

Step 2. Unroll and separate crescent dough into 16 triangles.  Spread each triangle evenly with Dijon mustard. Use a pizza cutter or knife to make 2 cuts into each triangle to make 3 smaller triangles.

Step 3. Place 1 piece of cheese and 1 sausage at the bottom of each smaller triangle and roll all the way up. Place about 20 wrapped sausages on the baking sheet in a large circular shape with the sausages radiating from the center, and sides of each roll touching each other. Arrange remaining rolled sausages inside the larger ring, slightly overlapping, to form a double layer ring.
Step 4. Brush rolls lightly with egg and sprinkle evenly with bagel seasoning.
Step 5. Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, 22 to 24 minutes.

Step 6. Meanwhile, for dipping sauce, combine mayonnaise, honey, stone ground mustard, vinegar, salt, and pepper in a small bowl and and whisk until well incorporated. Pour sauce into a bowl small enough to fit into the center of the crescent ring.
Step 7. Transfer ring to a serving platter and place sauce bowl inside the ring. Garnish with rosemary stems to resemble a holiday wreath. Serve warm or room temperature.

name: Crispy Brie and Cranberry Rice Paper Bites
ingredients: 15  rice paper wrappers (or more as needed)
directions:
Step 1. Gather all ingredients.
Allrecipes/Izy Hossack

Step 2. Cut the Brie into 15 equal-sized pieces, about 1/2 inch thick.
Allrecipes/Izy Hossack

Step 3. Take a wide, shallow bowl or a deep-rimmed plate and fill with warm water. Take one rice paper wrapper and dip it into the water, submerging it for a few seconds until slightly softened. It should still feel a bit rigid - this is key as it’ll make the wrapper easier to handle.
Allrecipes/Izy Hossack

Step 4. Lay the soaked rice paper onto a cutting board. Place about 1 teaspoon cranberry sauce in the center, top with a slice of Brie, and a sprinkle of chopped rosemary.
Allrecipes/Izy Hossack

Step 5. Fold the bottom half of the rice paper up and over the Brie.
Allrecipes/Izy Hossack

Step 6. Fold one side over top and one side underneath.
Allrecipes/Izy Hossack

Step 7. Finally, fold the top underneath.
Allrecipes/Izy Hossack

Step 8. Repeat the soaking and wrapping process with the rest of your ingredients. Place parcels on a lightly greased baking sheet.
Allrecipes/Izy Hossack

Step 9. Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a non-stick frying pan over medium heat. Once hot, add a few rice paper parcels. Do not crowd the pan or they will stick to each other. Leave them to fry until the underside looks bubbly and lightly golden in places. Flip all the parcels over and let them cook on the other side.
Allrecipes/Izy Hossack

Step 10. Remove parcels to a baking sheet. Continue frying remaining parcels, adding more oil as needed. Serve warm.
Allrecipes/Izy Hossack

name: Million Dollar Holiday Party Sliders
ingredients: 7 ounces Brie cheese, cut into 1/2-inch slices
directions:
Step 1. Gather all ingredients.
Allrecipes/Izy Hossack
Step 2. Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).

Step 3. Spread out sweet potato fries in a 9x13-inch dish. Bake in the preheated oven according to package directions until crisp, 10 to 12 minutes. Tip sweet potato fries out onto a plate and set aside.
Allrecipes/Izy Hossack
Step 4. Reduce oven temperature to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Step 5. Keeping the rolls together, slice them in half horizontally with a bread knife. Place base of the rolls into the same 9x13-inch dish you were using earlier. Mix mustard and mayonnaise together in a small bowl and spread mizture over the cut surface.
Allrecipes/Izy Hossack

Step 6. Spread shredded (or sliced) turkey on top of the mayonnaise, then top with crispy sweet potato fries. Lay Brie slices evenly on top. Dot all over with spoonfuls of cranberry sauce.
Allrecipes/Izy Hossack

Step 7. Place the tops of the rolls back on. Pour melted butter on top and evenly brush all over using a pastry brush.
Allrecipes/Izy Hossack

Step 8. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.
Allrecipes/Izy Hossack

Step 9. Bake sliders in the preheated oven at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) until Brie is melty and Parmesan is golden, 20 to 25 minutes.
Allrecipes/Izy Hossack

name: Cranberry Jalapeno Dip
ingredients: 3  green onions, chopped, green parts separated from whites
1 small jalapeno, seeded and membrane removed
1/4 cup honey or agave nectar, plus more for drizzling
crackers or pita chips for serving
directions:
Step 1. Gather all ingredients. 
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 2. Place cranberries, green onion whites, jalapeño, lime juice, cilantro, honey and salt in a food processor; pulse until just finely chopped and combined.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 3. Place in a fine mesh strainer over a bowl and set aside.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 4. Meanwhile in a medium bowl combine cream cheese, sour cream, and heavy cream. Beat with an electric mixer until fluffy and combined. 
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

Step 5. Spread cream cheese mixture on a serving platter and top with strained cranberry mixture. Sprinkle flaky salt on top and garnish with green onion greens. If desired drizzle with additional honey. Serve with crackers or pita chips.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios

name: Meet: Faddy's Meatballs, the Secret-Ingredient Appetizer My Great Grandmother Was Famous For
Meet Melting Snowman Board: the Best Holiday Appetizer You’ll Make All Season
Sriracha Deviled Eggs with Bacon
ingredients: 3 teaspoons sriracha, or to taste, plus more for drizzling
salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
directions: Step 1. Cook bacon in a skillet over medium heat until crisp, 4 to 5 minutes, and remove to a paper towel to drain. Chop and set aside.
Step 2. Slice eggs in half lengthwise, remove yolks, and place in a mini food processor (see Note) Set egg whites aside.
Step 3. Add mayonnaise, yogurt, sriracha, mustard, vinegar, garlic powder, salt, and pepper to the food processor, and process until smooth.
Step 4. Spoon filling into egg white halves. Alternately, add mixture to a piping bag or zip-top bag with the corner clipped. Pipe mixture into egg white halves.

Step 5. Sprinkle deviled eggs with bacon, garnish with a drizzle of sriracha, and serve.
 If you do not have a mini food processor, place yolks in a small bowl; mash with a fork until smooth, and stir in mayonnaise, yogurt, sriracha, mustard, vinegar, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. The sriracha will determine the spiciness, so feel free to adapt to your taste preference.Here's everything you need to know about how to boil eggs.

name: Sausage Stuffed Mini Peppers
ingredients: 1 5.3-ounce) package herb flavored Gournay cheese (Such as Boursin Garlic and Fine Herbs)
fresh parsley sprigs or fresh basil for garnish
directions: Step 1. Crumble sausage into a nonstick skillet over medium heat; cook and stir for 2 to 3 minutes.
Step 2. Add mushrooms, red pepper flakes, and green onions, reserving about 3 tablespoons of green onion tops. Stir until sausage is browned, 3 to 4 more minutes. Drain any excess fat.
Step 3. Remove skillet from heat and stir in Boursin until melted and well blended with the other ingredients.
Step 4. Fill each pepper half with about 1 1/2 tablespoons sausage mixture; place filled peppers on a baking sheet.
Step 5. Preheat the oven’s broiler.

Step 6. Broil until filling is lightly browned, about 3 minutes. Place on a serving tray and sprinkle with reserved green onion tops. Garnish with sprigs of fresh parsley or fresh basil. Serve warm or at room temperature.

name: Sriracha Deviled Eggs
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
directions: Step 1. Slice eggs in half lengthwise, remove yolks, and place them in a mixing bowl. Set egg whites aside.
Step 2. Mash the egg yolks. Add mayonnaise, sriracha, and mustard. Mix until well combined. Season with salt and pepper.
Step 3. Place egg yolk mixture in a piping bag and pipe mixture into egg whites. Sprinkle with paprika.

name: Stuffed Mini Peppers
directions: Step 1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Place peppers on a large baking sheet.
